questions.question: The government …………………….. a consumer protection agency last month.
questions.description: To simply state that something happened sometime ago, we use the simple past.

questions.question: The university ……………………… to establish an institute for Asian studies.
The institution of slavery ………………………… once widespread.
questions.description: Use the simple past for finished past events.

questions.question: She ………………………… that she heard someone in the house.
questions.description: When one verb is in the past tense, the other verbs too will most probably be in the past tense.

questions.question: The auditor …………………………. the books every month.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about routines, habits, facts etc.

questions.question: A fair and kind employer …………………………. loyalty.
questions.description: Use the simple present to talk about facts and general truths.

questions.question: When we got talking I found out that we …………………………. at school together twenty-five years before.
questions.description: Before is often used with a past perfect to count back from a past moment.

questions.question: My mom has a strange accent. She almost ………………………… foreign.
I will call you before I …………………….
questions.description: When the main verb is in the future tense, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to future.

questions.question: He ……………………….. school when he was twelve.
You ……………………………. me you were not coming.
questions.description: Could have + past participle is used to criticize people for not doing things in the past.
